game_description: Ever wanted to be a cyber ninja? A top-selling VR game and probably the best cyber ninja simulator ever, Sairento VR offers you that opportunity! Perform quadruple jumps, wall runs, power slides, back flips and even get to manipulate time. Empty lead into an enemy before spinning around to sink your blade into another. Kit yourself with katanas, firearms, bows, throwing glaives, shurikens, kunais and more - they are all at your disposal. Keep growing your experience and upgrading your skills. • Single player mode. • Co-op mode. • 10 exciting maps with hordes of enemies to test your ninja skills on. • A unique locomotion system that allows you to move and fight like a ninja. • Fight with more than 20 different types of weapons and develop your own combat style. • Keep upgrading your abilities and weapons as you accumulate experience from completing missions.
Languages: English, Chinese (China), French (France), German, Japanese, Korean, Spanish (Spain)
review_1: A lot of enemies that keep appearing out of nowhere in pretty limited environments. You don’t really engage in fights, there can’t be strategy as it’s too busy all the time and you end up just randomly sliding around with the swords in your hands, which makes you almost invincible and all the other weapons and stuff useless.
review_2: I have played the HTC Vive version before and I can definitely say it’s very different. The fun is still there, but a few options I liked are not. I miss big hand mode and the original maps (lab, cemetery, the one similar to warehouse, and all of the room clearing maps). If only those were added. Now, onto what I like about the Untethered version. 1. New enemies 2. New weapons 3. No tethers 4. Graphics look decent (like htc vive) 5. I can still have fun 6. I can do a flip Yeah that’s about it. Fun game, great company, go purchase it. Also, I would gladly pay for a DLC of the original Sairento maps.

review_5: This one was pretty fun and satisfying for a few hours, and I like the rogue-like leveling up. However, it somehow got pretty repetitive and I just drifted away. Maybe multiplayer is where it's at, but I basically found a rifle-sword combination and felt unstoppable. It's a bit underrated which is why I'm going 5 stars.
